title: Introduction to WordPress
note: Explains WordPress as a CMS, covering the difference between WordPress.org (self-hosted) and WordPress.com (service). Sets the stage for using WordPress to manage a website.

title: Local Development Setup
note: A guide to installing WordPress locally using tools like XAMPP or Local by Flywheel. Covers creating a database and running the WordPress installation.

title: Navigating the WordPress Dashboard
note: A guided tour of the WordPress admin dashboard, explaining the purpose of each main menu item from Posts and Pages to Settings and Plugins.

title: Creating Content: Posts vs. Pages
note: Details the difference between time-based Posts and static Pages. Covers using the Gutenberg block editor, and organizing Posts with categories and tags.

title: Managing Themes and the Customizer
note: Explains how themes control a site's design. Covers installing themes and using the Theme Customizer to change visual settings like colors, fonts, and logos.

title: Extending Functionality with Plugins
note: Explains the role of plugins in adding new features. Demonstrates how to find, install, and manage plugins from the official repository.

title: Managing Users, Comments, and Settings
note: Covers user roles and permissions, comment moderation, and configuring essential site settings like Permalinks and Reading/Writing options.

title: WordPress SEO, Security, and Maintenance
note: Covers three critical aspects of site ownership: basic SEO with a plugin, essential security practices (updates, strong passwords), and the importance of regular backups.

title: Developer: The Template Hierarchy
note: Introduces the core concept of theme development. Explains how WordPress uses a hierarchy of template files (e.g., `single.php`, `page.php`, `archive.php`, `index.php`) to decide which PHP file to use for rendering a specific page.

title: Developer: The Loop
note: Explains the standard PHP code block (`while ( have_posts() ) : the_post();`) that WordPress uses to display posts. This is the fundamental mechanism for outputting content in theme templates.

title: Developer: Hooks (Actions and Filters)
note: Introduces the core of WordPress extensibility. Explains Action hooks (`add_action`) for running code at specific events and Filter hooks (`add_filter`) for modifying data before it's used.

title: Developer: Child Themes
note: Explains why a child theme is the best practice for making custom modifications. Covers how to create a child theme to safely customize CSS or template files without losing changes when the parent theme is updated.

title: Developer: Custom Post Types and Taxonomies
note: Covers how to go beyond Posts and Pages by registering your own Custom Post Types (e.g., 'Portfolio', 'Events') and custom taxonomies (e.g., 'Event Type') to create structured, bespoke websites.

title: Developer: Introduction to the REST API
note: Introduces the built-in WordPress REST API. Explains how it can be used to fetch content in JSON format, enabling 'headless' WordPress setups where the front-end is a separate JavaScript application.

title: Developer: Managing WordPress with WP-CLI
note: Introduces the WordPress Command-Line Interface (WP-CLI) as a powerful tool for developers and admins. Demonstrates common commands for installing/updating core, managing plugins, and running database operations.

title: Developer: Introduction to Gutenberg Block Development
note: Provides a high-level overview of creating a custom block for the Gutenberg editor. Explains the basic concepts of using JavaScript (typically React) to define a block's structure, attributes, and behavior.

title: Advanced: E-commerce with WooCommerce
note: Provides an overview of turning a WordPress site into an online store using the WooCommerce plugin. Covers initial setup, adding products, and managing orders.

title: Advanced: Performance Optimization
note: Discusses key strategies for speeding up a WordPress site. Covers the importance of good hosting, implementing page caching with plugins, and optimizing images.
